scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. [Monica] says, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you helped out with the urgent task during your leave. That's really commendable, but don't you think it's setting a precedent for others to bother you on your days off?' You responded assertively, stating that maybe the team needs to be more self-reliant. Now, [Monica] frowns slightly and [Bob] raises an eyebrow. [Bob] remarks, 'Well, if everyone just starts saying no to extra work, won't that leave us in a bind during real emergencies?' You agreed with [Bob], saying perhaps you should have thought about the long-term implications. [Monica] now looks at you with a concerned expression and asks, 'So, what do you think we should do next time if there's another urgent task during someone's leave?' You proposed hiring more staff to cover these situations, indicating strong motivation but less empathy and emotional perception.
scenes.description: [Bob] crosses his arms and says, 'Hiring more staff sounds good, but it might not be feasible with our current budget. Any other ideas?'

options.text: Maybe we should create a flexible on-call roster to handle unexpected emergencies.
options.analysis: You suggest a practical solution that balances team needs with individual time off, showing good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: I suppose we could all pitch in and handle emergencies as they come, but it needs to be fair to everyone.
options.analysis: You lean towards a collaborative approach, emphasizing fairness and empathy, though social skills and motivation are slightly lower.

options.text: If we can't hire more staff, then maybe we need to reconsider our priorities and what constitutes an 'emergency.'
options.analysis: You propose a more critical review of what constitutes an emergency, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
